intro: Astragalus incanus var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. This variety is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
